content: Job: I Would Plead with God
I will give free course to my complaint,
I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
I will say to God, â€˜Do not condemn me;
Show me why You contend with me.
seem good to You that You should oppress,
That You should despise the work of Your hands,
And smile on the counsel of the wicked?
Do You have eyes of flesh?
Or do You see as man sees?
Your days like the days of a mortal man?
Your years like the days of a mighty man,
That You should seek for my iniquity
Although You know that I am not wicked,
And  no one who can deliver from Your hand?
